azurerm_lb_outbound_rule.description: Manages a Load Balancer Outbound Rule.

name.description: The name of the Frontend IP Configuration.

resource_group_name.description: The name of the resource group in which to create the resource. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

loadbalancer_id.description: The ID of the Load Balancer in which to create the Outbound Rule. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

frontend_ip_configuration.description: One or more `frontend_ip_configuration` blocks as defined below.

backend_address_pool_id.description: The ID of the Backend Address Pool. Outbound traffic is randomly load balanced across IPs in the backend IPs.

protocol.description: The transport protocol for the external endpoint. Possible values are `Udp`, `Tcp` or `All`.

enable_tcp_reset.description: Receive bidirectional TCP Reset on TCP flow idle timeout or unexpected connection termination. This element is only used when the protocol is set to TCP.

allocated_outbound_ports.description: The number of outbound ports to be used for NAT.

idle_timeout_in_minutes.description: The timeout for the TCP idle connection

id.description: The ID of the Load Balancer Outbound Rule.

create.description: Used when creating the Load Balancer Outbound Rule.

update.description: Used when updating the Load Balancer Outbound Rule.

read.description: Used when retrieving the Load Balancer Outbound Rule.

delete.description: Used when deleting the Load Balancer Outbound Rule.
